name: Hennur Countryside
description:
Join us on this ride to explore the pretty countryside in Hennur. Our route will take you through some of the most scenic parts of the region. From the meeting point, we'll head straight into a charming and rustic country road that'll give you a glimpse of local life as you cycle past small villages, farms, and fields. The route then goes beside the Hennur Bamboo forest, which is a beautiful stretch that offers a refreshing view of bamboo groves all around.

name: Devanahalli Heritage Ride

location.address: in association with bangalore local walks

description:
Explore the beautiful environs of Devanahalli Fort and Avathi village on a breezy bicycle ride through lakes, fields, heritage monuments and secret pathways. You'll hear tales of mystery, romance, palace intrigue and conquest. You'll stop by some beautifully restored railway stations from the colonial era. You'll bike through fields of roses, chrysanthemum and jasmine, and enjoy a delicious picnic breakfast at one of the most scenic spots in the area.

name: Workshop - Roadside fixes & Home maintenance

location.address: 837/1, 2nd Cross, 7th Main, 2nd Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka
location.name: Pedal in Tandem

description:
If you've ever been stranded on the road with a breakdown, you'll know the importance of bike maintenance. Even if you're new to cycling, this is essential know-how that will only make your journey into the world of bicycles even more fascinating. So come on over to our workshop and leave with some essential skills. You bring your own bike and we'll provide the tools. If you don't have a bike, just show up and we'll get you some hands-on on one of our bikes.


{}

name: Arkavathi Blues

location.address: backyard camp (upon request, accommodation can be arranged at backyard camp, the night before the ride)

description:
The Arkavati is an important river in Karnataka, originating at Nandi Hills, north of Bangalore in the Chikkabalapur District, and flowing down south through Ramanagara and Kanakapura. It then joins the Kaveri river further south, at Sangama. It forms several waterfalls on its journey, some small, and some large like the Chunchi falls. The region around the southern leg of this river is forested, and either adjoins or is part of one these protected areas - Nandi State Forest, Bannerghatta National Park, Basavanabetta State Forest and Cauvery Wildlife Sanctuary. Our routes skirt around these forests and pass through the many agricultural villages nestled between forest land. The Arkavathi and its many shades of blue will be in view during several sections of the ride. This is a meticulously crafted adventure cycling tour that combines these elements perfectly - the scenic countryside route, a picnic breakfast, a buffet lunch after the ride, all the support you need during the ride, and a fun group of riders to keep you company from the incredible Pedal in Tandem community!!

name: Rajankunte Quarry Loop

location.address: padukone - dravid center for sports excellence

description:
Join us for a fun ride to explore the pretty countryside in Rajankunte and the surrounding areas in north Bangalore. Our route passes through small towns and covers quiet and pleasant country roads flanked by fields and farms. En route, make pit stops at a couple of lakes and quarries, where you can take in these dramatic landscapes shaped by human interference.

name: The Melagiri Challenge
description:
Join us on this cross-country ride in the Melagiri Hills, through the tranquil Aiyur forest region, in Tamil Nadu.
 Be prepared for a breathtaking day tour in some challenging terrain. Our carefully mapped-out biking routes here weave through hills, forests, farms and several water bodies. Bicycle touring can't be more fun than this!
The 70 km (L3) ride includes an intense climb up a hill and through a forest, but the sheer beauty of these landscapes will make you forget your tired legs. The rest of the route is mostly flat or downhill.
 You can choose the easier 40 km ride (L2) too. It is not mandatory for everyone to ride the entire distance that’s planned. You could hop into the support vehicle if you wish, and still enjoy the rest of the journey in this enchanting land.

name: Good Old Nandi

location.address: a cycling adventure in the nandi area

description:
We scouted this new route on the back of our existing and very popular Nandi Countryside curation. A part of it is a hark back to the time when Nandi was but a little village with a pretty little train station in the early 1900's. Other parts are an exploration of the interior dirt tracks that run through vineyards and flower farms, and beside several lakes, most notably the one in Avati that sits beside a rocky shrub forest. We've even thrown in a short but sweet climb up a little hillock, with lovely views of the region from the top. This action-packed cycling adventure combines these elements in a way that you can appreciate them all in just a few hours on a Sunday morning. Why should cycling be reduced to the drudgery of unchanging and mindnumbing roads, set on repeat?Meeting Time: 5:45 amMeeting Point: Nandi Upachar Level-2 ride:Ride Distance: 45-50 kmCumulative Elevation Gain: 400 mLevel-3 ride:Ride Distance: 60-65 kmCumulative Elevation Gain: 500 m

name: Sound of Gravel
description:
Join our Sound of Gravel ride and experience what it's like to ride on gravel routes. What do these routes have in common with all our other routes? Well, they are just as deep in the countryside, away from traffic and the bustle of the city. Sometimes more. And they're almost completely off tarmac roads. These gravel routes vary from hard-packed dirt to smooth small-pebbled surfaces (which is actually known as gravel) that are non-technical but engaging, and smooth enough to do on a gravel or hybrid bike, typically bikes with 32mm or more tyres. Sure, you can do them on a mountain bike too. Road bikers-you need a steely pair to manoeuvre on these routes on your 25mm or 28mm slicks!Gravel:"small, rounded stones, often mixed with sand." ~ Cambridge dictionary. "aggregate of more or less rounded rock fragments coarser than sand (i.e., more than 2 mm [0.08 inch] in diameter)."~ Britannica. Gravel Riding Explained:"The ‘gravel’ discipline tends to describe riding a drop-bar bike on unpaved roads and trails, fitting somewhere between road cycling and mountain biking. In this case, the clue isn’t really in the name – gravel riding can encompass all types of terrain, from actual gravel to wooded singletrack and everything in between.As we’ll come on to, versatility is key when it comes to gravel bikes, and that extends to gravel riding as a whole. From super-chilled social rides to remote and demanding endurance racing, mass-participation events to dirt touring, there’s something in gravel for everyone."~Bike Radar .

name: Nandi Countryside
description:
Our route for this half-day tour weaves through the hills and lush forests around Nandi. We have curated rides of difficulty different levels in the region. The level-1 ride charts out a fairly easy route through some flat terrain while still touching upon several scenic spots. The climbs in the level-2 and level-3 route variations in this region are challenging, with some exhilarating descents. You will experience riding on quiet traffic-free forest and village roads, that run beside a couple of pristine lakes and dams. All the joys of bicycle touring wrapped into a few hours of riding.
